page.title: 05Wykeham Church
page.content: probably the original Holy Table. The oldest part of the church is the set of pillars on the north side which dates from the 13th century.the rest dates from the 15th century apart from the walls of north aisle and the east end which was rebuilt in 1853 by William Butterfield. {Wykeham Church. Wykeham Church in its present form, has the unusual distinction of having the spire seperated from the main building.The 7th Viscount Downe decided to build a new church as near to the old site as possible. William Butterfield a famous Victorian architect, much favoured by the 7th Viscount, was commissioned to design and build the church. The old church was ruinous and unsafe and had to be pulled down.
